etymologies: Old English mycg(e), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch mug and German Mücke, from an Indo-European root shared by Latin musca and Greek muia ‘fly’

definitions: a small two-winged fly that is often seen in swarms near water or marshy areas where it breeds.

notes.text: The families Chironomidae (the nonbiting midges), and Ceratopogonidae (see biting midge): numerous species

shortDefinitions: small or minute two-winged fly that forms swarms and breeds near water

definitions: any of a number of small flies whose larvae can be pests of plants, typically producing galls or damaging leaves.
shortDefinitions: used in names of other small flies whose larvae can be pests of plants
